title: Internal attachments can be exported via "Export as .zip" feature

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello HackerOne Team

This newly disclosed report: #182358 __Partial disclosure of report activity through new "Export as .zip" feature__ was not completely fix.

I have found that i can still view the attachment after it is being removed on the thread.

Best PoC is this #182358 since this is the newly fix and disclosed.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Go to https://hackerone.com/reports/182358
  2. Export the report as .zip
  3. Now extract the .zip file (`HackerOne_Report-security#182358.zip`)
  4. You will see that the image is still there, but base on the thread, you guys removed it on disclosed report.

I have attached the .zip file downloaded and save on my local and i can still view the removed image.

__Disclosed partially removed attachment:__ {F138022}

Regards
Japz
vulnerability_information_html:

I have attached the .zip file downloaded and save on my local and i can still view the removed image.

Disclosed partially removed attachment: {F138022}

Regards

activities.message: This means that you guys only fixed/removed the redacted confidential information on the thread, but not the image attachment, or i was thinking if the root cause is the __Attachment References__ `ex: {F134909}` is still there even the attachment is removed, and this causes the inclusion of the attachment in the export feature.
activities.markdown_message: This means that you guys only fixed/removed the redacted confidential information on the thread, but not the image attachment, or i was thinking if the root cause is the Attachment References ex: {F134909} is still there even the attachment is removed, and this causes the inclusion of the attachment in the export feature.

activities.message:
Thanks, @japzdivino. We can confirm that the attachment should not be included in the .zip. We'll get this addressed ASAP.

It's actually not the original attachment, fwiw. I removed the original attachment and re-added it under an internal comment. That's what you're seeing.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks, @japzdivino. We can confirm that the attachment should not be included in the .zip. We'll get this addressed ASAP.

It's actually not the original attachment, fwiw. I removed the original attachment and re-added it under an internal comment. That's what you're seeing.

activities.message:
@reed thanks for fast response , since i cannot see the original attachment, i believe because you said that you are the one who added it, anyways looking forward for the fix :)

Just ping me if you needed a verification on my end when the fix was release.

Have a great day ahead.

Cheers
Japz

additional_data.old_title: Removed attachment can still exported via "Export as .zip" feature
additional_data.new_title: Internal attachments can be exported via "Export as .zip" feature

activities.message:
Glad to hear! We're going to go ahead and resolve this now then. We still need to complete our investigation and decide on a bounty, so please be patient with us until both of those items can be done. :)

In the mean time, feel free to keep poking around and try to find any additional issues!

In the mean time, feel free to keep poking around and try to find any additional issues!

@reed great! sounds good :) , feel free to disclose at your convenience, just requesting to remove the attached image and zip file before public disclosure since that is intended for PoC purposes only.

Cheers
Japz

activities.message: Yup, we'll sanitize the report before disclosing. Feel free to go ahead and request public disclosure so we can go public immediately when we've completed the other items mentioned above.

activities.message:
Thank you, @japzdivino, for this report! We appreciate how easy it has been to work with you.

We are classifying this as "severe", so we're awarding the appropriate bounty based on that categorization. However, we're awarding more than our minimum, as we noticed that this issue also affects inline attachments as well, and we wish to reward you for that increased scope of finding.

We look forward to your future reports. Happy hacking!

summaries.content:
This issue was introduced on Monday, November 21st and resolved one week later on Monday, November 28th, within 90 minutes of the report being filed. We'd like to thank @japzdivino for bringing this to our attention and for working with us as we resolved the issue.

A new "Export as .zip" feature was released that permits teams to export the full contents of a report (including any internal comments and attachments). This is a useful feature for when a team needs to relay the full contents of a report to other colleagues who may not have access to HackerOne.

In this particular case, the vulnerability allowed for downloading internal attachments that would normally only be visible by team members. As part of our standard Root Cause Analysis, we also discovered that inline attachments could be misused to potentially view internal attachments at a future point based on guessing attachment identifiers.

HackerOne performed a thorough investigation of all uses of the "Export as .zip" functionality and have found no evidence of malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

Note that although #182358 looks similar on the surface, it is unrelated, as it was fixed before this issue was introduced.
summaries.content_html:
This issue was introduced on Monday, November 21st and resolved one week later on Monday, November 28th, within 90 minutes of the report being filed. We'd like to thank @japzdivino for bringing this to our attention and for working with us as we resolved the issue.

A new "Export as .zip" feature was released that permits teams to export the full contents of a report (including any internal comments and attachments). This is a useful feature for when a team needs to relay the full contents of a report to other colleagues who may not have access to HackerOne.

In this particular case, the vulnerability allowed for downloading internal attachments that would normally only be visible by team members. As part of our standard Root Cause Analysis, we also discovered that inline attachments could be misused to potentially view internal attachments at a future point based on guessing attachment identifiers.

HackerOne performed a thorough investigation of all uses of the "Export as .zip" functionality and have found no evidence of malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

Note that although #182358 looks similar on the surface, it is unrelated, as it was fixed before this issue was introduced.
Here is my blog: https://japzdivino.blogspot.com/2018/04/security-teams-internal-attachments-can.html
